Sentencas: LaFeO3, a mixed ionic electronic conductor, is a promising cathode material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFC).
Titulo: Defects and Oxide Ion Migration in the Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathode Material LaFeO3

Sentencas: Key to understanding the electronic and ion conducting properties is the role of defects.
Titulo: Defects and Oxide Ion Migration in the Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathode Material LaFeO3

Sentencas: In this study ab initio and static lattice methods have been employed to calculate formation energies of the full range of intrinsic defects-vacancies, interstitials, and antisite defects-under oxygen rich and oxygen poor conditions, to establish which, if any, are likely to occur and the effect these will have on the properties of the material.
Titulo: Defects and Oxide Ion Migration in the Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathode Material LaFeO3

Sentencas: Under oxygen rich conditions, we find that the defect chemistry favors p-type conductivity, in excellent agreement with experiment, but contrary to previous studies, we find that cation vacancies play a crucial role.
Titulo: Defects and Oxide Ion Migration in the Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathode Material LaFeO3

Sentencas: In oxygen poor conditions O2- vacancies dominate, leading to n-type conductivity.
Titulo: Defects and Oxide Ion Migration in the Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathode Material LaFeO3

Sentencas: Finally, static lattice methods and density functional theory were used to calculate activation energies of oxide ion migration through this material.
Titulo: Defects and Oxide Ion Migration in the Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathode Material LaFeO3

Sentencas: Three pathways were investigated between the two inequivalent oxygen sites, O1 and O2; O2-O2, O1-O2, and O1-O1, with O2-O2 giving the lowest activation energy of 0.58 eV, agreeing well with experimental results and previous computational studies.
Titulo: Defects and Oxide Ion Migration in the Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathode Material LaFeO3
